Dear Maria Elaina Lessnau:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 1-616-552-3662.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(v) Peer-on-peer discipline.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/18/23, a staff member instructed two residents to take a
youth out back and beat them up.
Investigation The complaint was received on 5/19/2023 and noted the following:
The complete complaint read as:
Youth A (9) resides at Christ Child House. Supervisor A is a
staff member that works at Christ Child House. On 5/18/23
between the hours of 7-8am Supervisor A told two residents to
take Youth A out back before school and beat him up. It is
unknown if any kind of fight occurred or if the conversation
between Supervisor A and the residents actually took place.
Youth A does not have any noticeable injuries, marks, or
bruises.
The referral source is the Clinical Director at Christ Child House. I
spoke with the referral source on 5/23/23 via the phone. She
reported she was in group with the residents on 5/18/2023 and
they were discussing consequences and incentives related to the
youth fighting a lot lately. The residents were given examples of
scenarios when fights happen, and the boys were coming up with
consequences. Youth B asked what if a supervisor tells you to go
hit another kid. Youth B was snickering when he asked this
question. Youth B reported that Supervisor A told a group of the
residents to beat up Youth A. She reported no bruises or marks
were visible on Youth A during group.
I interviewed Supervisor A on 5/23/23 face to face at the facility.
She is the night supervisor at Christ Child House. She reported on
the morning of 5/18/23 the staff were waking up the boys for
2

school and she was making a hot breakfast for them. After
breakfast the youth went outside to play before the bus and
transportation arrived to pick them up. Supervisor A reported
Youth A is the youngest resident at Christ Child House and is
aggressive, so they try to keep a close eye on him. Supervisor A
reported that morning Youth A was outside with Youth Worker 1
by the garage and Youth A was not cooperating with Youth
Worker 1 and she went to assist. Supervisor A reported that Youth
B and Youth C wanted to go get Youth A from behind the garage.
Supervisor A reported she told the youth not to go back there and
that she would get him but both boys ran ahead and went behind
the garage. Supervisor A reported Youth C ran behind the garage
and Youth A came out crying and said Youth C hit him. Supervisor
A said Youth C denied hitting Youth A behind the garage.
Supervisor A reported she felt Youth C was retaliating as Youth A
"slammed" him down in front of his peers previously. Supervisor A
reported Youth A ran inside the house and then wanted to fight
Youth C. She reported she put Youth A in the staff office with her
to keep him separated and to calm him down. Supervisor A
reported she was able to calm him down and then bribed him with
candy to get him on the bus. Supervisor A denied telling any of the
boys to beat up Youth A. Supervisor A was placed on
administrative leave on 5/18/23 pending the outcome of the
investigation.
I interviewed Youth A face to face at the facility on 5/23/23. Youth
A is nine years old and was placed at Christ Child House on
4/5/23 from a psychiatric hospital placement. Youth A reported he
was outside playing before school and ran behind the garage as
he got mad. He could not recall why he was mad and reported
Youth C and Youth D "popped out of nowhere" and punched him
in the chest 3-4 times. Youth A reported he was crying and ran
away from the boys and went inside. Youth A could not recall if a
staff member broke up the fight or not. He reported he wanted to
punch Youth C back and staff helped him not do it and then he got
on the bus and went to school. Youth A reported he did not have
any bruises or marks from the boys punching him. Youth A
reported he feels safe at Christ Child House.
I interviewed Youth C face to face at the facility on 5/23/23. Youth
C reported that Youth A was acting up and giving Youth Worker 1
a hard time the morning on 5/18/23. Youth C reported they were
all outside after breakfast playing basketball before they had to
leave for school. Youth A was with Youth Worker 1 behind the
garage. Youth C reported he and Youth D were with Supervisor A
and she told them “Go back there and beat him up" referring to
3

Youth A. Youth C reported he and Youth D went behind the
garage and Youth A was sitting on the ground and they punched
and kicked him. He reported Youth A ran off crying. Youth C
reported Youth Worker 1 asked the boys what they were doing
behind the garage and Supervisor A told them "Don't say nothing"
and "keep quiet." Youth C reported he went back there and
punched Youth A because Supervisor A told him too. Youth C
then reported Supervisor A really told them "Go kick his ass" but
he didn't want to swear. Youth C reported no other staff or youth
heard Supervisor A tell them to beat up Youth A.
Youth D was interviewed face to face in person at the facility on
05/23/23. Youth D reported he was outside before school playing
basketball and Youth A was picking on him and the other
residents. He reported Youth A was cussing at them and was
threatening to punch them. Youth D reported he told Youth A to
"get the fuck away from them". Youth D reported Youth A was
wandering around and went behind the garage. Youth D reported
Supervisor A told him and Youth C to "go beat him up" referring to
Youth A who was behind the garage. Youth D reported Supervisor
A said this because Youth A picks on us all the time. Youth D
reported he and Youth C went behind the garage and punched
and kicked Youth A. He reported Youth A began to cry so he
stopped hitting /punching. Youth D reported there were no other
youth or staff around when Supervisor A told them to beat up
Youth A. Youth D reported Supervisor A never came behind the
garage.
I interviewed Youth Worker 1 face to face at the facility on 5/23/23.
She reported that on the morning of 5/18/23 Youth A was agitated
and wanted to go outside after breakfast, so she took him. Youth
A played basketball until the older youth came out and then she
told Youth A he couldn't play with the bigger boys as he has a
history of antagonizing them. Youth Worker 1 told Youth A to go
for a walk out back away from the main road. Youth A went for a
walk back by the garage and she followed behind him. Youth
Worker 1 reported that suddenly Youth B and Youth C were
walking towards the back of the garage. Youth Worker 1 reported
she asked the boys what they were doing, and they said
Supervisor A told them they could go back there. Youth Worker 1
reported she told the boys to hold up and Supervisor A was
coming up behind them and told Youth Worker 1 that the boys
were going to "take care of business". Youth Worker 1 reported
she heard Youth A scream out Youth C's name and he was saying
"why are you hitting me". Youth Worker 1 reported Supervisor A
went back behind the garage and brought Youth A inside as he
4

was crying and hollering out. Youth Worker 1 reported she never
heard Supervisor A instruct the boys to beat up Youth A. Youth
Worker 1 reported she has never had any concerns with
Supervisor A's behavior or treatment of the youth. Youth Worker 1
was asked a second time to clarify the youth who went behind the
garage, and she identified Youth C and Youth B.
I interviewed Youth Worker 2 face to face at the facility on 5/23/23.
She reported she was working the morning of the incident. Youth
Worker 2 reported that she was outside by the car and saw Youth
A come running by screaming and crying. She said Youth B
reported to her that Supervisor A told the big boys to beat up
Youth A behind the garage and Youth F said, "sure did". Youth
Worker 2 reported she ran after Youth A as he was heading
towards the gate on the main road and Youth Worker 1 was
behind her. Youth Worker 2 reported that Youth Worker 1 was
upset and said to her she had Youth A calm by the garage, and all
was good. Youth Worker 2 reported Youth Worker 1 said to her
"she is fucking with Youth A" in regard to Supervisor A allowing
the boys to come behind the garage. Youth Worker 2 reported
Supervisor A asserts her authority with youth and staff more than
necessary and that Supervisor A has a different approach that is
more negative and escalates situations. Youth Worker 2 did not
hear Supervisor A tell any youth to beat up Youth A.
I attempted to interview Youth B face to face at the facility on
5/23/23. He refused to enter the room or talk. After Youth B was
named as one of the residents who went back and punched Youth
A I attempted to interview him again and he agreed. Youth B
reported he was on the side of the garage and saw Youth C punch
Youth A but he was not near the fight or Youth A. Youth B
reported Supervisor A was outside in the parking lot with him,
Youth C, Youth D, Youth E and Supervisor A said, "she was going
to turn her back when they beat him up".
I interviewed Youth E at the facility face to face on 5/23/23. Youth
E denied hearing Supervisor A tell any youth to beat up Youth A.
He reported that Supervisor A says, "if you all want to fight take it
behind the garage". Youth E did not go behind the garage or see
any of the incident as he was playing basketball.
I interviewed Youth F at the facility face to face on 5/23/23. Youth
F was very distracted during the interview and reported he heard
about Supervisor A telling the boys to beat up Youth A. He was
not clear if he actually heard her say it or if he heard it from other
youth. Youth F reported that Supervisor A always says she isn't
5

stopping the fight when the boys begin to fight/bicker at each
other. He reported that Youth C comes into his room and hits him
and Supervisor A watches and doesn't do anything. He reported
another staff helps them when this happens.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
Incident report completed by Youth Worker 1 on 5/18/23 @
7:45am- Supervisor A sent Youth C and Youth B behind the
garage to jump Youth A when he was back there to calm down.
Supervisor A told Youth Worker 1 that the boys were "taking care
of business".
Incident report completed by Youth Worker 2 dated 5/18/23 @
7:15am. Youth Worker 2 was asked if she did the report at
7:15am and she indicated she did in that evening after the
resident’s disclosure in group around 5pm. Youth B told Youth
Worker 2 that Supervisor A told some of the residents to beat up
Youth A behind the garage and Youth F said "yep she sure did".
Incident report dated 5/18/23 @ 5pm authored by referral
source/clinical director. The report is consistent with her interview.
Youth Worker 2 reported to her that two of the residents reported
the incident to her in the morning and she needed to report it.
Review of Christ Child House Discipline and Behavior
Management Policy. Prohibited procedures include discipline
action by residents against other residents.
Christ Child House Treatment Standards Policy under prohibitions
staff should never allow a child to be verbally or physically
aggressive with another peer.
Supervisor personnel file was reviewed, and no performance
issues were identified.
VIDEO REVIEW:
The facility does have video cameras, but they do not have video
camera's outside behind the garage. No video footage was
available of the incident.
6

Analysis Based upon interviews there is evidence to support peer on peer
discipline was used. Youth A, Youth B and Youth C all reported
Supervisor A told them to beat up Youth A. Youth Worker 1
reported Supervisor A told her the boys were taking care of
business when she asked why the older boys were coming behind
the garage. The three boy's stories were consistent with one
another that Supervisor A told them to beat up Youth A.
Supervisor A telling residents to beat up another resident goes
against the agency’s Discipline and Behavior Management Policy
and the Treatment Standards and Expectations Policy.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
